ygData.subject: Re: re: Lullaby and good night go to..
ygData.msgSnippet: I think brother ye listen too much to the music and not enough to the words. I ne er said it was ineffective.. just not as effective as it might be.  And since
ygData.messageBody:
I think brother ye listen too much to the music and not enough to the words.
I ne'er said it was ineffective.. just not as effective as it might be. And
since it is the only song I have yet encountered that did not fail just did
not have much of an effect even on a green it struck me as a concern. :)

Adon
----- Original Message -----
From: Mott, Mike J. <Mike.J.Mott@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, July 13, 1999 3:16 PM
Subject: [eqbards] re: Lullaby and good night go to..


> From: "Mott, Mike J." <Mike.J.Mott@...>
>
> I have seen a number of complaints here by those just making lvl 15 that
> Lullaby is ineffective. Well IMHO Lullaby is one of the absolute most
> useful songs I have in my arsenal, ranked right up there with Consonant
> Chain and Selo's.
>
> One thing I would like to stress here - MOST BARD SONGS ARE NOT VERY
> EFFECTIVE AT THE LEVEL YOU GET THEM! Give it a couple levels, get your
> skills up in the requisite instrument - All of a sudden the songs are more
> effective, being resisted less, you are missing fewer notes etc..
>
> I find the Lullaby particulary useful for train control. Last night in
Cazic
> Thule i was hunting with a barbarian warrior and a human cleric. He pulled
> from the throne room and a spawn occured and we were fighting 2 gorillas
and
> a lizard. Well with Lullaby, the two gorillas slept like babies. Now yeah
> they woke up, but a couple rounds after the "nod off" message, they were
> sleeping again and we all fought the lizard, moved to the next gorilla and
> then killed the last one. Could I do this effectively at 15th level even
to
> greens - NO! However as I have grown, the effectiveness of this song has
> grown with me.
>
> The same thing with Selo Consanant Chain. When I first got this at 23 it
> was resisted 80% of the time. That is down to about 25% of the time
against
> blues now, meaning that if I repeatedly sing this song i *can* stop a
runner
> before it goes and brings friends. Be patient, experiment, practice. Make
> your level, rinse and repeat <G>.
>
> Big disadvantage of Lullaby - cannot be juggled
> Big advantage of Lullaby - GREAT TO INTERRUPT THOSE PESKY CASTERS!
>
> Just my 2 copper.....
>
> Lago Bardoon, 30th Rank Bard of Bertox
>
> --------------------------- ONElist Sponsor ----------------------------
>
> ONElist: your connection to like-minds and kindred spirits.
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
